abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Karnataka Economic
            Restructuring Project includes: 1) reforms in fiscal policy,
            and public expenditure management; 2) administrative
            reforms; 3) reforms to promote private sector development;
            and, 4) strengthening of poverty monitoring, and statistical
            capacity. These comprehensive reforms will benefit the
            restoration of the state's financial health, governance
            and services delivery, and will help in achieving higher
            levels of private investments, and higher economic growth,
            in reducing poverty, and in improving social indicators.
            Nonetheless, risks remain over a potential slippage in the
            fiscal framework due to the global, and India's
            slowdown, and implementation delays of key sectoral reforms,
            particularly in the power sector. Further risks include the
            resistance to institutional, and governance reforms;
            however, such risks have been contained to date.
